history.text: Hi. So what movie is up for dissuasion?
Hi User 2. We will be discussing The Imitation Game. I must admit that I've never seen this movie. Honestly, I don't remember ever hearing of it. What about yourself?
I don’t remember seeing it either. I can’t even remember who stars in it.

Benedict Cumberbatch, Keira Knightley, Matthew Goode, and Tom Goodman-Hill are listed as the cast members. It came out in 2014 and is actually based on the biography of Alan Turing, but I've never heard of him.
Isn’t it a spy thriller if I remember correctly?
Definitely a good cast
Technically its listed as a Drama more so than a thriller, but yes, Alan Turning was a real-life British cryptanalyst who decrypted German intelligence codes during WWII
The k that makes sense. Biographies made into movies can be quite interesting.
I agree. They are indeed some of my favorite because the events actually occurred.
I need to go find this and watch it.
I still can’t believe I forgot about it.
I wonder if it is available on Netflix or Hulu. The reviews from the critics were mostly glowing. There were a few that thought it took much too much liberty in
expanding the material.
I think that is always the case in these types of movies. How else are they supposed to get an audience to sit through it without falling asleep.
I suppose you are right about that.
Reality isn't as exciting as make believe
(to some)
Yep plus we don’t always know the exact truth either.
That I can agree with. No matter what is written down in a book or told by an individual. Truth can be left out and altered by the person who lived it.
Very much true.
I was about to ask you when this conversation ends, but I see that I was provided with some new information in regards to the movie.
My document now lists some of the key scenes within the movie. One of which is about Turing's machine that he named Christopher.
I’m glad you were able to have the information. It is most definitely go on my watch list.
Ok that sounds cool. It still amazes me how much came from ww2
Me too. Maybe instead of so many commercials and previews we should get an overview of movies like this. It might inspire me to watch more.
WWII is definitely one of my favorite eras. There was just so much going on around the world.
I agree. I know people don’t like spoilers but I don’t mind reading overview and get the general idea of the movie.
It looks like we were given even more scenes! I thought that this was only going to last 5 minutes per conversation. I guess I should have reread the instructions. lol
Lol yea I think it said we had to reply like 15 times or something. I think it’s cool how they have this set up. Kiddos to the research team.
Any other interesting key scenes?
Well, while we are waiting here is some extra information for you. Apparently Turing talks Keira Knightly's character into marriage, but he is actually a homosexual.
Not surprised by that. Very common in that era.
He reveals this to one of his "friends" at his reception of all places and warns him to keep it a secret
Later, he will find out that his "friend" is actually a soviet spy! And of course if Turing outs him he threatens to out his sexuality.
Makes sense. It’s looks like we can finish now. It was really fun doing this with you. Hope you have a great day.
Thanks you too!

uid2response.feedback: We both got into talking about it. The movie sounds really interesting.
